poem:
**Flight of the Missing Kittens**

found in the hold  
love's tender burden—  
whiskered hope,  
Crete-born, star-eyed,  
lost in the belly of  
steel wings,  
ascends  
to anxiety's thin air—  
rescued twice over,  
now where?  
for the wide-eyed  
beating heart of new beginnings  
a dance in sky's embrace  
awaits.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Couple tell of ordeal when kittens went missing after being left in plane hold A newlywed couple who married in Greece have said they feared the worst when three kittens they rescued from Crete went missing after being left in the hold of an aeroplane. They first travelled to the island in September 2023 and found the mother cat, who “had a very distinctive bulging eye that needed to be removed”, Bethany Mulcahy-Stephenson, a veterinary". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
